N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 508.8 - Assisted outpatient treatment (aot)

State Regulations
(a) ACT providers shall establish mechanisms
to ensure priority access by individuals who are subject to an AOT order
pursuant to section
9.60
of the

Mental Hygiene Law. (b) ACT
providers shall cooperate with the office and the local governmental unit or
their representatives to ensure priority access by individuals who are subject
to an AOT order and assist in the development, review, and implementation of
treatment plans. (c) Prior to any
such individual's discharge from an ACT program, the provider shall notify the
director of the AOT program and assist in the determination of whether such
individual is appropriate for case management services. If the individual is
determined to be appropriate for such case management services, then the
provider shall assist the director of the AOT program in arranging for such
services. (d) Any and all related
information, reports, and data which may be requested by the office or the
local governmental unit in connection with an individual who is also enrolled
in an AOT program shall be furnished by the provider of services in accordance
with applicable law. (e) Any
requests from persons or entities authorized pursuant to section 33.13 or
33.16, for clinical records regarding persons who are the subject of, or who
are under consideration for, a petition for an order authorizing AOT, shall be
given priority attention and prompt response in accordance with applicable
law. Notes
